Description: Lower body sherd of large Corinthian black-figured pottery alabastron; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of feline standing to left (forelegs remaining); on the left, part of lotus and palmette with added red on kalyxes and outer petals; below, reversed 'Z' frieze between pairs of black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, pl. XVIII, no. 51)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 457, no. B769)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.278) (phase 3)
